title: Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock and Roll
creator_credit: W-film, cine-connect, John Pirozzi and Andrew Pope
headline_credit: Cambodia, France and United States of America, 2014
brief_description: Through the eyes, words and songs of its popular music stars of the 50s, 60s, and 70s, Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll examines and unravels Cambodia’s tragic past, culminating in the genocidal Khmer Rouge’s dismantling of the society and murder of 2,000,000 of its citizens.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.
